AnimationTicker.name: AnimationTicker
AnimationTicker.description:
Class to controll animation. It calls a callback method every requestAnimation frame.
In case of Internet Explorer 9, it uses a setTimeout with 16 ms.

BaseAnimation.name: BaseAnimation
BaseAnimation.description:
BaseAnimation interface class for most frame / time based animation.
Please do not instantiate this class. Use the extended classes.

SpriteSheetAnimation.name: SpriteSheetAnimation
SpriteSheetAnimation.description:
Spritesheet Animation class This class will animate a spritesheet. It already handles responsiveness.
So If the size of the SpriteSheetAnimation div is set, the animation will fit in the defined size.
If a size is not set, it'll use the size defined in the JSON object.

params.name: data
params.description:
Object defining spritesheet. The Spritesheet image and json needs to be generated by Adobe Flash.
It also accepts *trim* and *border* parameters set when exporting the Spritesheet from Adobe Flash. Name |Type|Default|Description -----|----|:------|----------- image|Image|null|Image of spritesheet. It can either be a Image Element or PreloadJS image loader, which gives *data.tag* as image. json|Object|null|JSON object defining the spritesheet. It can either be an Object or PreloadJS json loader, which gives *data.tag* as object. useBackground|Bool|false|Boolean indicating if the Spritesheet Animation should use as background-image or a image element. Default is **false**. It's safer using an Image element instead of background-image for cross-browser integration.

EventDispatcher.name: EventDispatcher
EventDispatcher.description: EventDispatcher class for handling and triggering events.

classitems.description: Add a callback method that will be called every requestAnimation.
classitems.name: add

params.name:
callback
Callback
params.description:
function to be called on every browser update.
The callback method will be called passing a `data` parameter which will contain the `data` passed in this method and the `frame` number if the `fps` value is set in the `data`.
If the callback function already exists, it'll only update the `data`.

params.name: data
params.description:
All values in this object are optional.
```
{
	"fps": 0 // Number. Frame rate to update.
	"initFrame": 0 // Number. Use value when adding a animation that doesn't start at frame 0. Ex: starting a animation from a middle.
	"delay": 0 // Number. Delay in seconds to start triggering the callback.
}
```

classitems.description: Remove a callback method added by {{#crossLink "AnimationTicker/add:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: remove

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function to be removed.

classitems.description: Triggered when animation starts. Usually when {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}} is called.
classitems.name: PLAY

classitems.description: Triggered when animation stops. Usually when {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/stop:method"}}{{/crossLink}} is called.
classitems.name: STOP

classitems.description: Triggered when animation resumes. Usually when {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/resume:method"}}{{/crossLink}} is called.
classitems.name: RESUME

classitems.description: Triggered when animation pauses. Usually when {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/pause:method"}}{{/crossLink}} is called.
classitems.name: PAUSE

classitems.description: Triggered when animation finishes.
classitems.name: COMPLETE

classitems.description: Triggered when animation reached the end and repeats.
classitems.name: REPEAT

classitems.description: Triggered when animation changes it's frame.
classitems.name: UPDATE

classitems.description: Return true if the animation was paused
classitems.name: paused

classitems.description:
Define if the animation will repeat or not.
By default it's set to false.
If the value is set to true, it will repeat infinitely.
This value can also be changed when calling the {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method.
classitems.name: repeat

classitems.description: Frame rate of animation.
classitems.name: fps

classitems.description:
Current time of the animation in seconds.
If it's playing a specific label, it refers to the portion of the label.
classitems.name: currentTime

classitems.description:
Total time of the animation in seconds.
If it's playing a specific label, it refers to the portion of the label.
classitems.name: totalTime

classitems.description:
Current frame number of the animation.
If it's playing a specific label, it refers to the portion of the label.
classitems.name: currentFrame

classitems.description:
Duration in frames of the animation.
If it's playing a specific label, it refers to the portion of the label.
classitems.name: durationFrames

classitems.description: Total number of frames of the animation.
classitems.name: totalFrames

classitems.description: The name of label currently playing.
classitems.name: currentLabel

classitems.description: Add a section of frames with a label name.
classitems.name: addLabel

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the label

params.name: start
params.description: Number of frame that the animation should start

params.name: end
params.description: Last frame of the section. If this parameter is not set, will get the next label's `start` or the last frame of entire animation.

classitems.description: Remove a label
classitems.name: removeLabel

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the label

classitems.description:
Play the animation.
It receives a `data` object which is optional with some settings.
classitems.name: play

params.name: data
params.description:
Data with values explained below:
Name |Type|Default|Description
-----|----|:------|-----------
delay|Number|0|Delay in seconds to start the animation
{{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/repeat:attribute"}}{{/crossLink}}|Boolean \| Number|false|If the animation should repeat. If number is passed, will repeat the amount of number defined.
label|String|null|The label of the animation to play. If nothing is passed, will play the entire animation.

classitems.description: Resume the animation. If the {{#crossLink "BaseAnimation/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method was called with a label, it will resume the portion of the specified label
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description: Pause the animation.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Stop the animation and goes to last frame.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Add a event listener.
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Event name.

params.name: handler
params.description:
A callback function to handle the event.
The callback function can receive 1 or 2 parameters. The first parameter is the event data itself and the second parameter is the custom data of the triggering event.

classitems.description:
Remove an event listener.

**BEWARE**

> Calling this method without a handler will remove all listeners attached to this event.

> If calling without the event name, will remove all listeners attached to this instance.
classitems.name: off

params.name: event
params.description: Event name.

params.name: handler
params.description: A callback function added in the {{#crossLink "EventDispatcher/on:method"}}{{/crossLink}} call.

classitems.description: Triggers an event.
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: event
params.description: Event name.

params.name: data
params.description: Custom event data.

params.name: target
params.description: Target that will be specified in the `event.target`. The `event.currentTarget` will always be this instance.

classitems.description: Check if a event handler is already set.
classitems.name: hasEvent

params.name: event
params.description: Event name.

params.name: handler
params.description: A callback function added in the {{#crossLink "EventDispatcher/on:method"}}{{/crossLink}} call.

classitems.description:
Triggers an event after the current code block has finished processing.

This is useful for stacking up events that needs to be triggered at the end of the function but it's validating beforehand.
classitems.name: stackTrigger

params.name: event
params.description: Event name.

params.name: data
params.description: Custom event data.

params.name: target
params.description: Target that will be specified in the `event.target`. The `event.currentTarget` will always be this instance.
